name: Treinta
headline: Digital ledger App for Latam microbusinesses
description: Treinta is a digital ledger app for Latin American microbusinesses with over 5 million users across 18 countries. Through Treinta, users can easily record transactions by assigning products from their inventory and see how their business metrics evolve in real time. Users can also access a B2B marketplace and digital payment solutions.

founders.name: Lluis Canadell, Founder
founders.description: My passion is to help micro and small businesses in Latin America succeed. Since 2020, I am the Co-Founder of Treinta, a mobile app that enables micro entrepreneurs to seamlessly transition to digital solutions and optimize management of their companies. My prior professional experience spans three years in management consulting and one year in investment banking and private equity.

founders.name: Man Hei Lou, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder at Treinta. Building the tools to empower microbusinesses to become more competitive in Latin America.

**Treinta: Simplifying Finances for Microbusinesses in Latin America**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from Bogotá, Colombia, Treinta is a standout digital ledger app designed specifically for microbusinesses across Latin America. With a solid backing from Y Combinator's Batch W21, Treinta has gathered over 5 million users in 18 different countries—a testament to its growing popularity and effectiveness in this niche.

The mission is clear: to help small business owners manage their financial transactions effortlessly. Users can record sales, monitor their business metrics in real time, and even access a B2B marketplace along with digital payment solutions. The platform’s user-friendly design allows for easy inventory management, making it convenient for anyone—from street vendors to small shop owners—to maintain their accounts digitally.

Treinta prides itself on being a free solution, simplifying the management of finances, inventories, and sales without the hassle of traditional accounting methods. The company also employs around 120 people and works under the guidance of Group Partner Dalton Caldwell. 

The app provides various essential services, such as:
- A comprehensive Point of Sale (POS) system tailored for both restaurants and retail.
- Access to a leading inventory marketplace that connects traditional suppliers with local businesses.
- Options to augment income through services like mobile phone recharges and payment processing solutions.

Treinta’s success and user satisfaction are reflected in its strong app ratings (4.7/5 in Playstore) and enthusiastic testimonials from users who rave about its ability to streamline their business operations.

As Treinta continues to expand its functionalities and user base, it remains committed to supporting the economic growth of microbusinesses in the ever-evolving landscape of Latin America. You can explore more about Treinta by visiting their website at [treinta.co](https://www.treinta.co).
